review: Disappointing.  Chairs need cleaning since you hands get sticky.  Balsamic vinegarette very strong.   High priced. Food so so. Side salad small.  Restrooms smelled of sewer.  And needed cleaning.

Let me start by saying that TGI Friday's atmosphere & vibe are great BUT they need to have a deep-cleaning done! Tables were dirty & seats were sticky...  The staff here seems to be quite genial and they are pretty much on top of things. The menu isn't Vegan friendly at all. Luckily the manager was generous with his time in helping to accommodate my dietary needs.

was seated & left to our own devices (literally) for almost 15 minutes with servers and front workers just sitting around talking to eachother. many passed by & made eye contact with us & still no service. not a fan of walking out of restaurants but I will not give my money to an establishment so unwelcoming & unprofessional.

Lunch Prices??? Cold Soup??? Think again.  We stopped by on a Monday around noon. When ordering, I clearly pointed at a lunch priced combo of soup and salad. It should have been around $8. My husband ordered the same thing. Instead of bringing the lunch portions, our waitress brought us the regular portions and charged us for that. It end up being about $12 more than what we had originally ordered! On top of that, our soup was brought out to us COLD. Our waitress sat around and talked while we tried to get her to come to our table. (We were one of only 2 tables in the whole restaurant!!!)  When the soup was reheated, it was still thick and floury. The salad was pretty bland. We will absolutely never go to this TGI Friday's ever again, and probably never go to another one.

Service was good! FOOD SUCKED!!! We had Potatoe skins as an appetizer and they just put the cheese on top n was barely melted. French dip, Same thing so I sent it back to melt the cheese. Meat was fatty and lacked flavor. I would've been more satisfied eating at  Taco Bell or Wendy's

I've had salads at other TGIs in Illinois and decided to try this one in Merrillville and I have no desire to return. Visited on Saturday May 2, on a beautiful sunny afternoon. The two Caucasian women assigned to greet customers were very unpleasant and stern. There were a few customers present but they were all seated in the same generalized area. My guest and I were taken to a booth in the same area and strongly told to wait until the mass of food under our table was sweep up. We independently went to sit at another booth and one of the very unfriendly greeters told us that the section was closed and quickly walked away and never directed us to another section. We returned to the front of the restaurant and ended up sitting in the bar area. The area  was surprisingly quieter than the compact area were they were continuing to set  the few customers that came into the restaurant. Derrick, the bar attendant served us and was he was very pleasant. The food was so-so.  Wanted dessert, but decided to go elsewhere. Went across the street to Red Robin's and was greeted well by smiling staff.  Stopped by Chili's the week before and it was filled with customers. Even on the day of my visit to TGI's, I glanced across the road at Chili's parking lot and it was pretty full. If customer's are being treated like we were then I see why there are so few customers patronizing the restaurant. Competition is stiff, learn how to treat your customers. Some people are not meant to be greeters and will likely reduce your profit margin.

Let me preface this by saying that I have never been a huge fan of this chain. It's not a place I ever pick to go but I will go if others I am with choose to. Therefore, I had low expectations going in. My last experience here earlier this month, which is very likely to be my absolute last, was pretty terrible. Just blew those already low expectations away. I seriously wish I could give them a negative rating.  We had a group of 8 and Friday's was chosen because we were celebrating the birthday of a recently deceased friend who had loved this place. We planned on going here ahead of time so we attempted to make a reservation. We were told they did not take reservations. We showed up at 5:00 on a Thursday night - told it would be 40 minutes for a table since we had such a large group. Apparently, the only option for a large group is an oversized booth which was currently occupied. We asked if they would be willing to push some tables together and they said it was against their policy. I would understand an unwillingness to push tables together if it was busy but the restaurant was less than half full and likely to stay that way since it was a weekday. The only suggestion the snotty hostess made was that she could seat us at separate tables near each other. We were not willing to sit separately given the reason for our gathering that night and quite frankly did not see the point of going out as a group just to sit separately. So, they won't take a reservation but are unable (unwilling, really) to accommodate more than one large group at a time? What business does this? We asked to speak with the manager and he just reiterated this policy as if we didn't understand the first time. Blank stare when we explained the stupidity of this policy. I don't know if this is a corporate policy or a rule for this particular location, but either way, this place clearly did not want our business.  We finally were seated about 50 minutes later. It took forever to get drinks, food, checks, really anything requested. We all understand that things take a little longer with a large group but the length of time it took to get anything was ridiculous even for a group. The food was mediocre at best. The portions were so ridiculously small for the price. It's like they spend more time trying to plan what else they can add to their stupid Jack Daniel's menu that they forget how to just do the basics and give people a decent amount of food. I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp and the size of the chicken breast was smaller than what would be recommended for someone on a very strict diet and 4 shrimp...for $13. Not worth it. With an appetizer, two drinks, my meal and a sandwich our bill was $50! Um, seriously? When I received my slip to sign for my credit card transaction I saw that the waitress ran my card for $175. When I showed her the mistake she seemed so confused and didn't know what she did. Eventually figured it out. She never apologized either. An honest mistake or an attempt to rip me off? You decide... The best part of this whole experience (and "best" is dripping with sarcasm): As we walked to our table we noticed two tables pushed together with 7 people near us. Interesting... And surprisingly enough, as we were sitting in our booth shoved in like a bunch of sardines and elbowing each other each time someone moved an inch, we watched a group of 10 come in and get seated in two tables close to each other. Once the hostess left they proceeded to push the tables together and not a single employee said anything to them. Not even the manager when he walked by. The hostess walked by to seat another table in the middle of them rearranging the furniture and said NOTHING. We still can't figure out why this was OK for that table and not for ours. Not one person in our group was loud or rude, even when speaking to the manager. I don't know what we did to receive such unfair treatment but I'm not about to go back and find out.
Food was awesome as well as the service tonight. Stephanie was our server and she was training Amy. Would definitely recommend sitting at their table.

During the summer the restaurant was extremely cold. When we asked them to adjust the temperature, it changed a very small amount. My wife's food was cold, and her chicken breast was fattier than normal. The plates were relatively small and I would have liked for some more in my portion. I have dined at Friday's before and this location is definitely below average. I would have stayed for dessert but It was too cold!!

It's time to close TGI Fridays remodel the restaurant, and gut the stinky washrooms. The restaurant decor hasn't changed in over 20 years they need to get rid of items from the 60's and 70's. Like the picture of Marilyn Monroe who died in 1962. Friday's food is ok but stick to the regular items( cheese burgers, chicken bruschetta pasta or chicken sandwiches). We understand the restaurants chain was recently sold so hopefully changes will be coming soon. Sad to say TGI Friday's is no longer our "to go place"

Now I see why nobody goes to TGI Fridays anymore.  Met a friend for drinks this evening, we sat in the bar area, which was dead (as was the restaurant). My friend was waiting for me and had already ordered a drink; I had to wait 10-15 minutes for the server to come by and take my drink order. We were never asked if we wanted water or if we wanted to order apps or dinner. Our drinks sat empty for 15 minutes until I decided to stare the servers down (they were super busy chatting behind the bar , although facing us). One reluctantly came by and asked if we wanted another round. We said yes, and before we could say we wanted to order apps she turned her back and went to the bar. We finally were able to ask her if we could order as she set our drinks down. We received our apps and had to ask for plates. The servers never came by to ask how the food was, and after we finished eating had to flag one of the servers down for a final round of drinks.  TGI. Fridays corporate leadership would be devastated if they saw the industry's target market being treated like garbage while there are a hundred-us empty seats in their restaurant. Too bad for them as we're millennials/ young GenX, both with six-figure incomes, and our friends/acquaintances are of similar profiles. Too bad for us because we would love to make a place like this our regular spot, considering the $3 (and well-made) martinis and decent appetizers (although the spinach flatbread taste like unbaked pita bread smothered in cream cheese).

Called to order pickup and was put on hold for 20 minutes, even called back at a point assuming they had forgotten about me but to no avail was put back on hold because they were "too busy" to take an order.  It was also 11 pm on a Wednesday of all the times.

The restaurant seemed pretty dead and silent, but my waiter was alright. She was attentive and accommodating, which is the way it should be. I had the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta which came out nice and warm. I finished it, so that must mean something. Overall the experience was normal and nothing out of the ordinary.

I come to Friday's a lot (almost every week or two). I usually sit in the bar area for the five dollar apps but we sat in the restaurant area this visit to celebrate a birthday.  Food was ok. Service seemed slow for the small amount of people in the restaurant.  We received our Stripes chips and then our beer cheese pretzel app shortly after. We then all had our meals brought to us except for the chicken fingers dinner. The waitress finally came around and we mentioned we were missing a meal. She never mentioned the reason or even apologized. She just stated it will be out shortly. Everyone else pretty much were done with their meals by the time it finally came out. After seeing the *rush* on the receipt, that tells me the order didn't get entered initially. I understand mistakes happen, but I don't appreciate her not acknowledging the issue. She also tried taking the appetizer that still had food on it. I had to ask her to leave it as we were still all eating from it.  We had a Stripes reward coupon that took forever to register. Half of our party left before we were done paying since it took so long.  Lastly, on our way out the staff that seats people and opens the doors were inattentive. There were about 5 teenage girls just talking while grandma had to wait for one of us to hold the doors open for her since she walks with a cane. I am a regular Yelp reviewer since I travel a lot and don't just review when I have a negative experience. I hope the management at this location can learn from this to ensure others have a better experience than we had.

I wish that I had read the other reviews.  Upon entering, there was no hostess. I went around the corner to ask, then someone came to seat us.  We were seated after a booth was "cleaned."  I ended up cleaning underneath the table, which was full of uneaten food. The table is still sticky.  It took over 10 minutes for our waitress to come take our drink order.  She reappeared another 10 minutes later with our water.  I don't have high hopes for our food.

Not happy with the service at TGI Friday in Merrillville, IN. Went in last night for dinner and a drink, sat at the bar with my boyfriend because we wanted to see the end of the Cubs game. But the bartender was kinda a jerk. Treated my boyfriend very disrespectful. I was kind astonished, I know it's Halloween weekend and maybe him having to wear a Svengoolie looking costume was a bit much but don't take it out on us. My boyfriend the sweet natured guy he is was like what the f*@k I'm not going to let this idiot ruin my night out. I was let's go I'm not patronizing a place that is disrespectful to its customers. We hadn't done anything to warrant this. Personally I won't go again.

On 12/21 me and a friend went to this horrible place.  We walked in and noticed several booths open in the bar area.  Decided to sit there. Upon walking up to the tables we noticed that none of them were clean.  We stood there for at least 5 min with 3 people behind the bar and not one person acknowledged us. Now I'm not one to play the race card, but we are black and every patron in the bar area was white. As we watched them continue to serve everyone else but us!  HMMM...So we decided to sit in the main dining room, and were told they had no booths.  So the kind hostess offered to bust one of the tables and the manager scolded her for doing this. At this point we were pissed. Thinking that this mgr was going to come and help us. Not the case. We just left and definitely will never return! Should have gone to Schereville like normal, but this is actually closer.  Never again will I ever step foot in that place again. PEOPLE LISTEN! DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION EVER! I HOPE THEY CLOSE IT OF FIRE THE ENTIRE MANAGEMENT STAFF!!!!

I always sit at the bar area great service food is good prices are fair. I come here for lunch and never experienced bad service it's never overly packed and the waitresses does a great job on staying on top of everything. The other comments are pretty surprising since I never experienced anything that they have maybe they got a new staff and they got better training should give it another try if you had a bad experience!

Service was terrible. Waited a good 15 minutes just for drinks. The waiter had an attitude about EVERYTHING. I asked for a high chair for my 2 year old because apparently they can't offer one, and you'd think I asked him to go out and buy one with the way he acted about bringing me one. The place itself was disgusting and dirty. If I could put less than 1 star I would. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Definitely will not be eating there again.

Who doesn't love TGI Fridays. Food is good, service is good and prices are good. You never have an extremely long wait usually you are seated right away, if there is a wait it's no more than 15-20 minutes.

I'm so disappointed with the service and bar at this location.  Not only did the server took his sweet time with 75% of the restaurant empty, we still waited 22 min for drinks, for "end-less" apps....it took more then 15 min per order with 75% of the restaurant empty..it was 62° outside and 75° inside so everyone was sweating and they packed everyone who came in after 830 in one corner ....dont get me wrong the food is on point and we did enjoy the drinks when they did finally get there. Also watched a family of 7 walk out after being told 20 min wait sat for a while more then 20 min. I had to bring our baby home so I left my wife and other children ....before I left my beer was ordered and I made it home before the beer and endless apps made it to the table..i live 20 min away. I felt terrible for my wife and her sister.

Food was good quality, however, service was slow during lunch.  There were plenty of staff with several empty tables but the wait was still longer than expected for sandwiches. Drink refills were not offered until we were almost ready to leave.

Called to make reservation and was told to go to Open Table to make the reservation. Made the reservation for 8:30pm. Get there and half my party sitting at the bar. Spoke to the guy who said he was the manager but he had no name tag and didn't have on TGI Friday's attair. We were told they can't seat us until half our party was there. When asked why was told that they don't keep reservations and that they are first come first served. When asked why was I told to make reservations, all of a sudden the "manager" couldn't remember to whom I spoke as of he vanished in thin air. He also tried to make it seem like someone on staff was posing as a manager. We finally were seated and counted 25 empty tables in the section but were told we couldn't put any together to accommodate the group. Next thing we know a police officer come back to our area and lingers against the wall by us and follow anyone in our group outside and stare at them out the window the entire time. What an uncomfortable situation. The manager shouldn't be in customer service profession.  The servers were professional and that's the only good thing I can say. I will never go back there and I will never recommend this place to anyone. Save yourselves.

-No hostess at the front door so we waited awhile for a table.  9:30 pm on a Sunday night and less than five families/couples were in the restaurant. -The place stunk!  It has a funky, malodorous smell throughout. -The floors are super sticky, much like that of a bar at the end of night.   -The changing table in the women's bathroom is too high and would be quite a fall for any child -My dirty salad dish and utensils remained on the table throughout the meal.  -My husband's salad included the hard end of the head of lettuce -Only good thing about the visit - Brian, our waiter, was friendly and attentive

Husband & I were out for a weekend wondering, stopped here for a bite since we hadn't eaten all day. First, was told to seat ourselves. Second, the restaurant was poorly cared for. Upon ordering, our waiter asked if we would prefer our salads out before our meals, we responded with "yes, please". Thirty mins later our salads finally came with our dinners directly afterwards. I asked the person that brought out our meals for some more ranch dressing and immediately received an extremely rude "huh, yeah!" The dressing never came. Our waiter finally returned to our table, and we explained that we asked for our salads before our meals & that now our dinners will be cold by the time we get done with our salads. Then he "apologetically" with an eye roll said he would not charge us for the salads. I then requested to speak with a manager. The "manager" responded to our complaints with a condescending tone and an extremely unprofessional approach for a manager of a well known establishment. After she disconcertingly sashayed away from our table, our waiter reappeared asking if the manager was able to assist us. I responded with a sarcastic "oh yes, she was a huge help!" The waiter then rudely responded with, "well you're getting free food!" By this time we're done with this type of treatment and requested the bill. The bill came, nothing had been discounted or removed, we paid leaving no tip. Absolutely horrible experience!! The wait staff and management needs fired or retrained! That is IF they were ever trained at all! Don't waste your time & money at this restaurant!
Great service and great portions. The wait staff was very attentive and amazing to work with. ENDLESS APPS. Can't beat bottomless boneless wings. Two thumbs up from this guy

The food was okay the company I was with was AWESOME- birthday celebration  we had burgers, wings, and chicken strips, mojitos, sodas and beers. The best part of our meal was when my sons girl Asked the waitress- (who was amazing)- do I have to be 21 to order the Jack Danneels Burger - it's open late and we had a good time with family and friends!

Very disappointing.. Have gone there 3 times.. Why why why 3 times! Should have quit at 1. There portions are so small it should be an appetizer. Prices are to high for the size you get. The food is mediocre at best. Only thing worth even thinking of going for is the style of the inside. Avoid this place.. You're better off going to McDonald's..
This place has the smallest portions I've ever eaten at a restaurant. While the food is good it's too small portions for the price I will never go back

Why does this place smell like black people and piss?? And is the hostess even on shift, you literally have to wait 30 min to be seated only to find out that you can sit wherever you'd like. Service is always bad and the tables are always dirty. And don't even look underneath, the floor hasn't been cleaned since they opened and it's sticky and our table smelled like a cat took a piss under the table 5 years ago. The food is good tho and I love their strawberry black tea. But just beware your surroundings when visiting this place, you might catch MRSA or Ebola
